intro: Strephonema gilletii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Strephonema gilletii is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and fragrance.
